item.title: Litter all over street for days, 3rd February
item.description:
See above has been weeks with excessive litter leading to rodents

item.title: Persons in Allotments All Night, 3rd February
item.description:
Again people in Old Farm Allotments during hours of darkness causing a nuisance. Woke up a neighbour who reported it to police due to headlights on and engine running. Crime number supplied. incident reported due to council repeatedly saying “Lack of Evidence”

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 295, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain on pavement outside Kfh, 3rd February
item.description:
Blocked drain in pavement outside kfh estate agents on the corner of Albemarle and High Street. Pavement completely flooded and right over where pedestrians have to stand to cross the road. Been like it for too long.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12a, High Street, Beckenham, Greater London

item.category: Street cleaning - Grass verges / Shrub beds - Littering

item.title: Bug in Fix My Street - 'My account' - Yellow or Green status pins, 3rd February
item.description:
This is not a street report. It is a bug report about Fix My Street! In 'My Account' the last three reports I made have been fixed. However in the top level summaries, Yellow Pins are displayed indicating pending work. Clicking on any one shows the correct Green Pin ie that the issue is Fixed. I attach screenshots. Please ask the FMS organisation to fix the bug. It is unhelpful to see the list but a false status on whether issues have been fixed or not. Thank you. There us no option to report bugs, so I had to use this random Flyposting option.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement is unusable due to bulky bins, 3rd February
item.description:
Unable to use the pavement and unsafe to let kids walk on this side of the street. The bins are almost always overflowing. Large planks of wood, crates and other items are left next to the bins in an unsafe manner. Oakley Place attracts tradespeople who dump their bulky waste on the pavement with these bins. The bins have no place on the pavement - needs dealing with.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakley Place, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe accident-damaged car, 3rd February
item.description:
A black car that has been in a bad accident has been parked near this junction for over 3 weeks and is causing some problems with its dangerous crash damage. Not sure why it hasn’t been removed by now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Iron Mill Lane, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 17 Foulden Road pipe draining on public pavement, 3rd February
item.description:
17 Foulden Road: Install of pipe from terraced house that empties water onto public pavement. New installation of grid on pavement underneath pipe. Hazard for residents, walkers and animals

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pipe draining onto pavement at 17 Foulden Road, 3rd February
item.description:
There is a pipe draining onto the pavement originating from 17 Foulden Road N16. This has been recently installed. Residents are concerned about freezing water danger, falls, and potential hazards that may come with this

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: We have a big hole exposing pipes at Avebury Court within the parking space courtyard, 3rd February
item.description:
Whoever dug up the courtyard at Avebury Court, has not come back to fix the issue and fill the hole. Its dangerous as its right by the entrance into the block. We are now overrun with rats running in and out of the hole making it their living space.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colville Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole causing damage to card, 3rd February
item.description:
Large wide pothole on the dip where Mickleham Road intersects with St Paul’s Wood Hill. (Roundabout)There is already an unnatural dip in the road here (caused by previous roadworks) that is not great for cars coming off the roundabout but the pothole is now extra damaging to tyres and suspension
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Mickleham Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped green bin between 2 houses, 2nd February
item.description:
Green bin between 24 and 25 Eltham Green Rd is not collected for more than a month because of incorrect content (there is an oooops label attached). It is never close to any of the houses and seems to be used as public bin to dispose of random garbage. None of the houses nearby have missing green bin, so most likely it was stolen from somewhere and dumped.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Meadowside, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This vehicle has been unattended for over eight months, 2nd February
item.description:
This vehicle has been in a private car park for over eight months and is untaxed and blocking residents from parking. Nobody in this community owns this vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 234, Anerley Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
